{"step_by_step_thinking": "Odd-chain fatty acids undergo beta-oxidation in the same manner as even-chain fatty acids. However, once a five-carbon chain remains, the final spiral of beta-oxidation will yield one molecule of acetyl CoA and one molecule of propionyl CoA. This three-carbon molecule, propionyl CoA, can be enzymatically converted to succinyl CoA, forming a bridge between the TCA cycle and fatty acid oxidation. Therefore, the correct answer is B. Propionyl CoA.", "answer_choice": "B"}
